chinese: (~s) [usu. pl.] clothes or shoes suitable for everyday wear rather than formal occasions 便服；便装；便鞋
examples: e.g. While the trend toward business [[casual]] is characterized by more comfort, for some, it means more confusion.

chinese: [pl.]（头戴式）耳机
(only before noun) belonging to or relating to a corporation 公司的
examples: e.g. Owing to the shift of its strategic focus, the company is moving its [[corporate]] headquarters from New York to Houston.

chinese: [C] a legal arrangement by which you borrow money from a bank or similar organization in order to buy a house, etc. and pay back the money over a period of years 抵押贷款
examples: e.g. Since she was having trouble meeting her [[mortgage]] payments, she was considering selling her apartment.

chinese: [U] time for rest or recreation away from the usual work or studies 休息（或休假）时间
examples: e.g. You won't get paid for time off unless you have a doctor's note.

chinese: [C, pl.] the main building or offices used by a large company or organization 总部；总公司；总办事处
examples: e.g. There are now 400 staff at [[headquarters]], servicing our regional and overseas work.

chinese: [C, usu. pl.] sth. that you get legally from your work in addition to your wages, such as goods, meals, or a car （工资以外的）额外收入（待遇）；津贴
examples: e.g. I eat all three meals per day, five days a week, in the company because they are free — one of the [[perks]] of the job.

chinese: relating to the work of managing a company ororganization 行政的；管理的
examples: e.g. Even [[administrative]] regulations must be accompanied by persuasion and education.

chinese: [C] a company or person that supplies shops and companies with goods 分销商；经销商；批发商
examples: e.g. Some US states require that foreign wines be shipped to an importer or [[distributor]].

chinese: 1) supporting or allowing gradual political and social changes （思想）开放的
examples: e.g. The company has adopted a more [[liberal]] policy on the health care benefits of its employees.；e.g. He has a [[liberal]] attitude about whether students should wear uniforms to school.

chinese: 2) willing to understand and respect other people's ideas, opinions, and feelings 思想开明的；开通的
examples: e.g. The company has adopted a more [[liberal]] policy on the health care benefits of its employees.；e.g. He has a [[liberal]] attitude about whether students should wear uniforms to school.

chinese: 1) sth. that exists between one thing or person and another and keeps them separate 分界线；屏障；隔阂
examples: e.g.There was no real [[barrier]] between reality and fantasy in his mind.；e.g. Lack of confidence is a psychological [[barrier]] to success.

chinese: 2) a problem, rule or situation that prevents sb. from doing sth., or that makes sth. impossible 障碍；阻力；关卡
examples: e.g.There was no real [[barrier]] between reality and fantasy in his mind.；e.g. Lack of confidence is a psychological [[barrier]] to success.

chinese: difficult to distinguish, so that differences are not clear 难以区分的；模棱两可的
examples: e.g. The boundaries between history and storytelling are sometimes [[blurred]].

chinese: [C] a small part of a room that is separated from the rest of the room 小隔间
examples: e.g. The rules of [[cubicle]] etiquette exist in order to make the workplace a harmonious place.

chinese: change sth. so much that it appears to be entirely new 彻底改造；重新创造
examples: e.g. It's wonderful, because this fresh start gives us a chance to [[reinvent]] our lives and ourselves.

chinese: [sing.] a way of life in which people compete aggressively to be successful 你死我活的竞争
examples: e.g. I have to get out of the [[rat]] [[race]] and take a look at what I really want in the first place.

chinese: [C, U] a system of organization in which people or things are divided into levels of importance 等级制度
examples: e.g. She worked her way up through the corporate [[hierarchy]] to become a member of the top management.

chinese: (also ~ out) become or make sth. flat or flatter （使）变平；（使）变得更平
examples: e.g. Martin [[flattened]] out a napkin and started to perform a magic trick which immediately engaged the kids.

chinese: [C] a man who is supposed to have magic powers; witch 男巫；术士
[C] in the past, a Japanese fighter with special skills （旧时的）忍者，日本武士
[U] the combining of two or more things so that they work together effectively 结合；整合
examples: e.g. His music is an [[integration]] of tradition and new technology.

chinese: [U] 针刺疗法
[C] a short sleep, esp. during the day （尤指白天的）小睡，打盹
examples: e.g. A midday [[nap]] may be a better way to cope with the mid-afternoon sleepiness than more nighttime sleep.

chinese: [C]（飞机的）吊舱，发射架
[C] 小憩舱；打盹舱
(BrE popularise) make sth. well known or liked 宣传；推广
examples: e.g. The musician collected and [[popularized]] many songs written by other musicians.

chinese: [C] a formal inquiry or systematic study 调查
examples: e.g. An [[investigation]] has been launched into the potential impact of the oil spill on marine life around the island.

chinese: expressing strong opinions publicly, esp. about things that you disagree with 激烈地表达意见的；直言不讳的
examples: e.g. Foley has been particularly [[vocal]] in his criticism of the social injustice he has witnessed in his country.

chinese: [C] sb. who disagrees with or resists a proposal or practice 反对者
examples: e.g. Leading [[opponents]] of the proposed increase in defense spending will meet later today.

chinese: [C] the area in a newspaper or broadcasting office where news is processed （报社、电台或电视台的）新闻编辑室
examples: e.g. The best hours of Walter's life were not spent in a [[newsroom]], but in pursuit of a worthy story.

chinese: [C] a new small company or business, esp. one whose work involves computers or the Internet （尤指从事计算机或因特网的小型的）新兴公司，新创办企业
examples: e.g. For now the bright spots in the labor market are small businesses and high-tech [[start-ups]].

chinese: [C, U] a piece of writing, music, etc. or an action that copies sb. / sth. in an amusing way （文章、音乐等的）滑稽模仿作品
examples: e.g. Some stories from the TV series released by the local newspaper yesterday read like a [[parody]].

chinese: 1) a description or representation of sth. （对某事物的）描绘，描述，表现
examples: e.g. Her latest novel paints a very vivid [[portrait]] of the aristocracy in the 1920s, which has been a mystery to most readers.；e.g. Today, she is still considered one of the greatest [[portrait]] painters of her time.

chinese: 2) a painting, drawing, or photograph of a person 人物画像；人物照片；肖像
examples: e.g. Her latest novel paints a very vivid [[portrait]] of the aristocracy in the 1920s, which has been a mystery to most readers.；e.g. Today, she is still considered one of the greatest [[portrait]] painters of her time.

chinese: [C, U] the action of making people pay attention to the wrong thing, usu. intentionally so that they will not notice sth. else 误导
examples: e.g. The global debate on bank capital has been characterized by rumor and [[misdirection]].

chinese: 1) (infml.) very bad 极糟的；恶劣的
examples: e.g. I personally think it's a [[rotten]] idea to go camping on such a rainy day.；e.g. Check stored fruit every week and throw out any that has started to go [[rotten]].

chinese: 2) badly decayed and no longer good to use 腐烂的；变质的
examples: e.g. I personally think it's a [[rotten]] idea to go camping on such a rainy day.；e.g. Check stored fruit every week and throw out any that has started to go [[rotten]].

chinese: (recast, recast) change the form of sth. 重塑；重组
examples: e.g. She [[recast]] her novel as a musical comedy, which turned out to be a greater hit than the original work.

chinese: [U] a condition that makes sb. work a lot of the time and find it difficult not to work 醉心工作；迷恋工作
examples: e.g. It is a danger of [[workaholism]] that one may risk getting their identity caught up in the work.

chinese: (unwound, unwound) undo or be undone after winding or being wound （卷绕物）解绕；展开
examples: e.g. She [[unwound]] her scarf after entering the house, and hung it on the rack in the corner.

chinese: [C, U] the quality or state of being ridiculous or wildly unreasonable 荒谬；荒唐
examples: e.g. Duncan shook his head and laughed at the [[absurdity]] of the situation.

chinese: [C] the usual or normal situation, way of doing sth., etc. 常态；规范；标准
examples: e.g. Short-term contracts are now the [[norm]] with some big companies.

chinese: [C] 手提箱；衣箱
officially announce that you have decided to leave your job or an organization 辞职；放弃（工作、职位）
examples: e.g. Tom has [[resigned]] his membership of the golf club.

chinese: using cruel words or physical violence 谩骂的；虐待的
examples: e.g. The goalkeeper was sent off for using [[abusive]] language against a linesman (边线裁判员) .

chinese: send a short message using the social networking service Twitter （使用推特社交网络）发送（信息）
examples: e.g. Today you can [[tweet]] your messages out to the world with a mere click of the mouse.

chinese: [C] a claim or assertion that sb. has done sth. illegal or wrong, typically one without proof （尤指无证据的）宣称，指控
examples: e.g. He made [[allegations]] of corruption against the administration.

chinese: [C] a balance between two opposing things, that you are willing to accept in order to achieve sth. （两种对立事物之间的）平衡，妥协，协调
examples: e.g. There has to be a [[trade-off]] between quality and quantity if we want to keep prices low.

chinese: making you feel very sad 令人沮丧的；让人忧愁的
examples: e.g. There was another side to the story, just as dramatic, but not so [[depressing]].

chinese: appear in a place or situation unexpectedly 突然出现
examples: e.g. She was startled when Lisa [[popped]] up at the door all smiles.

chinese: stop listening or paying attention to what is being said 不听；不注意；不理会
examples: e.g. The pressure from information overload can make some people [[tune]] out messages altogether.

chinese: spend a lot of time in a place or area for no particular reason 闲逛
examples: e.g. I used to [[hang]] out with my friends in the park, but it has now changed beyond recognition.

chinese: used after a negative statement to say that the next thing you mention is even more unlikely 更不用说，更谈不上（用于否定句之后）
examples: e.g. Because of his knee injury, he cannot walk any more, let alone play golf.

chinese: occur or arrive by chance 不期而至
examples: e.g. I waited a long time until a film script [[came]] along that I thought was genuinely funny.

chinese: (of liquids) available by turning a tap （液体）打开阀门即可获得的
examples: e.g. A lot of local pubs feature a wide selection of imported wines as well as beers on tap.

chinese: at the cost of 以···为代价
examples: e.g. Prolonging life at the expense of its quality can rob elderly people of meaningful years.

chinese: 密歇根州（位于美国北部）
俄亥俄州（位于美国东北部）
盖尔 • 金（人名）
迈克 • 罗宾斯（美国团队合作、领导力、情商等领域的专家）
丹 • 莱昂斯（美国作家、编剧）
《硅谷》（电视连续剧剧名）
前沿网（美国科技媒体网站）
奥斯汀・奥尔雷德（人名）
罗恩・弗里德曼（美国心理学家）
